title: Waistcoat Front, 1740–60
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk-core threads on silk foundation
Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp float patterning and discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Left and right fronts of a gentleman's waistcoat. Large metallic scrolls and polychrome silk flowers on a textured ivory ground. Brocaded in 13 colors of silk and 6 metallic yarns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat Front, 1740–60.
1740–60. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk-core threads on silk foundation
Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp float patterning and discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading). Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-4-a,b.
